lines.text: Hold the cattle, boys. Don't let 'em hit the fence.
You two always were a pair of onery, hot-headed kids - always practicin' slingin' a six-gun when you should have been huntin' strays.
Don't forget it was you who taught us. You figured it was important we learn how to shoot.
Yeah, and I wish now I hadn't.
Warren, you're through. Roll your blankets and get out!
Just a minute, Jimmy. You may be trail boss, but I'm still headin' this outfit. He's a good gunhand. We need him.
I've got a hunch you're makin' a mistake, Frank. Warren's been actin' mighty strange lately.
All right, but I'm warnin' you, if the law don't help us, we'll settle this with hot lead!
In the mean time, Sheriff Perry, I hope you won't tell anybody about it.
I'm silent as a desert tortise when it comes to spreading news.
Why you connivin' old wart, I wouldn't put it past you to rustle your own beef.
Let me give you some advice. Stay away from my ranch and stay away from Ellen. If you don't there's gonna be gunplay.
You'll have Miller tied up tighter than a cat in a gunny sack.
The boots on the other foot now and it pinches, don't it?
